name: william
text: I have to try sit-down peeing side saddle now.

name: overmedicated
text: Shouting 'yeah man! we doin' this!'? Hell yes.

name: dangelder
text: Odds are there's a Heche en Mehico sticker on the side of that camera.

name: gorrioncita
text: ... mehico?

name: biznart
text: Like Speedy Gonzales likes to say.  I theenk.

name: freerhi
text: in the universe of achewood, if you speak while someone takes a photo of you, the words will appear as a speech bubble in the developed picture.

name: petitegitan
text: It's hard to aim.

name: soticoto
text: How could aiming even come into it when toilet-bowl is over 50% of the urethra's surrounding world, and the >50% favoured by gravity for that matter?

name: ford
text: for a second i thought you said "flavored" by gravity.  This made the comment even better.

name: rhadamanthus
text: it does evoke such as a malt beverage yes

name: soticoto
text: I'll endeavour to make more comments where words can be misinterpreted as other words from now on... and add a sprinkling of black hole for flavour.

name: pigeon_street
text: for a second i thought you said "traditional family barbecue" to make more comments, etc. This made the comment make no fucking sense .

name: apocowarg
text: Don't let your pepper touch the rim.

name: farqussus
text: I think it would almost guarantee pepper-rim contact.

name: lizjones
text: Ray Smuckles: Trustbuster

name: heatbag
text: I love that the digital camera also managed to capture what he was saying when the photo was taken.

name: jamers
text: It was hecho en mexico.

name: ananke
text: A comment left by ananke was marked lame too many times and excluded. (marked lame by glorify, trisha, katethegreat, LordPretzel, St-Elmos_Fire, tragicone)

name: cailetshadow
text: It's Yoshitaka Amano's concept art for Final Fantasy 6. Locke.

name: hateandwar
text: NEEEEERRDS!

name: i_love_kate
text: I am surprised that this comment has garned no lames for fangirlism over a pretty boy J-pop singer. Is Assetbar becoming more open minded?

name: carlyle
text: It's been two years, and I can say with some authority "I don't really hang out on Assetbar, so I don't really have the authority to comment on it's collective open-mindedness."

name: tellumo
text: Well, Ray is a character in a comic strip. For all we know, his words just appear in text balloons that float above his head as he speaks.

name: soticoto
text: You suppose that means you could pluck them out of the air and smack someone with 'em?

name: sandswipe
text: Yes, but it's generally considered bad form.

name: littlefatdog
text: Your avatar makes it seem as if you're FAQ Ray, the administrator of Achewood Did You Know? Question Answering Service, popping in to clear up any ambiguities.

name: benthecartoon
text: This was done in Who Censored Roger Rabbit, I believe, which was one of 2 or 3 books that the movie was based on.

name: st-elmos_fire
text: Thank you for inadvertently telling me where Roger Rabbit originated

name: benthecartoon
text: Yeah, I haven't gotten to read them yet, but apparently they were comic strip characters instead of animated, and lots more violence, swearing and death than you would think from the PG (although increasingly censored) film.

name: shinkusan
text: Such shenanigans were pulled in the old and venerable comic Pogo.

name: ferdinand
text: i love that ray slurps his martini with his tongue.

name: geysershitdick
text: Well he is a cat, dude.

name: carlyle
text: I think he's just trying to get the residue because he finished it all.

name: quinlaenar
text: I always just assumed that Little Nephew was taking a video on the camera.

name: connormc
text:
I came back to this strip the other day and realized that and was all "whoa I bet no one even thought of that!" and then I saw you had. A year ago.

So basically this chubby is because I have been outclassed on this one and I damn well know it.

name: tombsgrave
text: I quote the alt text all the time.

name: slanger
text: The gong!  The fake accent!  The "did we party?"!  There is so much to love.

name: djwhiterabbit
text: Alt text:  "Riddle:  What's the difference between John Wayne Gacy and Santa Claus?  A:  John Wayne Gacy will stop at nothing to kill you."

name: plozza
text: A comment left by plozza was marked lame too many times and excluded. (marked lame by fakead, goocifer, GitarooMan, JuanCarlos)

name: mortshire
text:
...He took off all their clothes for them
He put a cloth on their lips
Quiet hands, quiet kiss
On the mouth...

name: gormster
text: A comment left by gormster was marked lame too many times and excluded. (marked lame by fakead, alexrosenbaum, InspectorGadget, chattyclasses)

name: ovenface
text: lots of times when i hit the 'oh my god are you one of them' part of that song, i can't help but laugh at how silly and nonsensical sufjan can sound sometimes. that is not a very good song to laugh about, though.

name: prettyrad
text:
And in my best behaviour
I am really just like him
Look underneath the floorboards
For the secrets I have hid.

*Intake of breath*

*Intake of breath*

Creepy.

name: greyfield
text:
I came back to this strip today to make a joke (of the form "what's the difference between A and B? A stop at nothing to kill you"). I look at the alt text, have a chuckle, then realize...

...my iTunes is PLAYING THIS SONG. Freaky as hell.

name: semiquaver
text: Yeah I mean if you are seriously listening to that song you can really work up to a good cry or desperate late-night phone call to your mother.

name: sp1derbaby
text: "Mom, I did it again..."

name: fermatprime
text: "M-Mom? Mommy? I made a really bad decision..."

name: tombsgrave
text: Best.  Alt-text.  Ever.

name: gmm
text: It is, both very funny and deliciously dark.

name: saint
text: he will even give you presents for being good. It's just that the presents might contain hazardous materials...like...a lion.

name: charchar
text: "They are otherwise, in all respects, one and the same."

name: honesttom
text: Santa will try to kill you, but stop after the initial rage has subsided.

name: sp1derbaby
text:
Like many Irish households, we leave alcohol and biscuits out for Santa.

It's pure coincidence that he visits England right after Ireland.

name: deancain29
text: Im totally saying this next time I pee

name: aaron_haynes
text: Somehow it never occurred to me that Little Nephew probably does want to eliminate Ray as a competitor for selling weed.

name: connellingus
text: Yeah, my first thoughts when seeing this strip were that Little Nephew is just playing a cruel prank on Ray, but then I went back and remembered the strip where he sells pot to Téodor with an elaborate code.

name: tellumo
text: Yep, LN's blog confirms that he was using the Japan Man ruse to eliminate his uncle's competition.

name: heavymetaljesus
text: I can only imagine what would happen if you try to step up on Santa's game.

name: riazm
text: Little Nephew would later sell the gong to Ray on eBay, claiming it was the same one Dennis Quaid punched in Rush Hour 2.

name: biznart
text: Quaid wasn't even IN Rush Hour 2.

name: wmscottsimpson
text: But Little Nephew knows he doesn't know that.

name: alexaker
text: I'm the This Is The Strip That Made Me An Achewood Fan guy for this one

name: stuart
text: I like how Ray threatens an allegedly Japanese man attempting to squelch his illegal drug business with the reminder that monopolies are illegal in America .

name: semiquaver
text: When Ray says "illegal," he basically means that it will not fly with the hip, modern, source-conscious pot clientele of today.

name: echidnaboy
text: Lyle and Ray's perfect Jays are targeted at politically-aware stoners who prefer their illegal drugs to be locally sourced and organically grown, with a small carbon footprint.

name: i_love_kate
text: So, hippies?

name: semiquaver
text:
Bennington students/Vermont residents.

[/selfburn]

name: falseprophet
text: In Japan, they call him Annual Gift Man and he lives on the moon.

name: presterjohn
text: You're quoting the Simpsons but you're also quoting John Waters ... I don't know what to think.

name: tekende
text: But what do they call Santa?

name: hateandwar
text:
This was the first Achewood strip I ever saw. At first I just got the impression that Ray was some fat rich guy being a dick and hanging around in a tracksuit, drinking a martini and talking about partying and business with people, just some complete walking shit. I wanted nothing to do with this shitty character or his retarded comic.

Then I got to the side-saddle peeing business. And I fell in love forever.

name: sp1derbaby
text: It is indeed a powerful tableau.

name: fosters
text: That seems like more than a small difference, unless you're talking about really just incredibly terrible kids.

name: sp1derbaby
text: Santa puts your presents in his sack, John Wayne Gacy puts you in his sack. Both sacks are wicked.

name: xiaomimi
text:
Weekend Blogs

Ray: No luck with the gardener lady.
Pat: I'm back.
Philippe: Hosey the Flow Cow!

name: numberkillinger
text: rays blog is especially hilarious today

name: dasuta
text: Man.   That riddle.   Blows the mind, no?

name: blacksheepboy
text:
[IMGS OFF]
maybe there is no difference between santa claus and japan man

name: stuart
text: "I'm gonna shove coal so far up your stocking you'll be coughing up diamonds! "

name: shoinan
text: I love that Ray's first instinct is that he probably had a party with Japan Man.

name: atypicaloracle
text: I loved this strip more before I got to the panel revealing Japan Man as that little hosebeast.
